name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to construction
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall provide to the Engineer, full details and specifications of the anchorbloc including ACEGrid and locking bar. Details to be provided by manufacturer
Verifying Document - Technical/ product data sheet, Delivery dockets, ITR-Incoming Mateirla Inspection (DN-QUA-QC-10)
3.2 - Material Compliance - AP65 (M4 if required) basecourse
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to construction
Acceptance Criteria - free of unsuitable material as defined in the Earthworks Specification.
○ Fill to contain no more than 20% passing a 75μm sieve.
○ Fill to have maximum particle size of 100mm
○ Fill particles shall be able to be incorporated within a single layer. Further, less than 30% of particles shall be retained on the 37.5 mm sieve.
○ Unless otherwise approved, the MSE Wall Fill shall have a Liquid Limit less than 70% and a PI less than 6%.

○ MSE Fill shall be able to be tested in accordance with conventional compaction test methods for soil. Where Nuclear Densometer is used, these methods require less than 20% retained on the 37.5 mm sieve. Where between 20% and 30% of particles are retained on the 37.5 mm sieve the above test methods shall still be adopted and test reports annotated appropriately including reference to any test calibration or correction adopted
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Lab Test Report
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to construction
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall provide to the Engineer, full details and specifications of geogrid reinforcements details including manufacture data
○ STRATAGRID SGU80 to or equivalent to be used as per 80510096-02B-900-C470 Rev 1 drawing
Verifying Document - Technical/ product data sheet, Delivery dockets
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Following Excavation
Acceptance Criteria - Minimum of 3 blows/100 mm penetration
Verifying Document - Scala Testing Record Sheet DN-QUA-QC-04
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Following Excavation
Acceptance Criteria - The foundation for the retaining wall subgrade must be inspected by the Engineer and shall be approved for the placement of the wall facing elements and reinforcement elements
Verifying Document - Site Instruction - Hold point release / email
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Foundation prep
Acceptance Criteria - Foundation Compaction: 95% MDD and+/- 2% of OMC as determined from the plateau test/or lab testing. None less than 92%
○ 1 set of NDM tests (comprising 5 No. NDM tests per set) are required per 200mm fill lift
Verifying Document - NDM Test Results DN-QUA-QC-09
Frequency - 1 set of NDM tests (comprising 5 No. NDM tests per set)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Survey as-built
Acceptance Criteria - Anchor blocks shall be placed into correct position, alignment and angle according to drawings
Verifying Document - Photo Record, as-built records
4.5 - MSE Wall Backfill AP65 - Compaction Testing
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - MSE Wall Backfill
Acceptance Criteria - Foundation Compaction: 98% MDD and+/- 2% of OMC. None less than 95%
○ 1 set of NDM tests (comprising 5 No. NDM tests per set) are required per 200mm fill lift
4.6 - MSE Wall Backfill AP65 - Visual Inspection
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - MSE Wall Backfill
Acceptance Criteria - The backfill must be witnessed by the engineer with fill layers not exceeding 200mm.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - MSE Wall Backfill
Acceptance Criteria - 80510096-02B-900-C470 Wrap top, bottom & front edge with STRATAGRID SGU80
Frequency - Placement/ Prior to backfill of upper layers
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Upon completion of works
Acceptance Criteria - As built survey record completed
c) Level of surface trimmed to receive wall: ± 50 mm
DS2681-SH58-ITP-TW-001 Bridge 3 Crane Pad and Cofferdam
template name: DS2681-SH58-ITP-TW-001 Bridge 3 Crane Pad and Cofferdam

name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works

Acceptance Criteria - Prior to installation, a visual inspection of the sheet piles will be conducted to ensure they are in good condition. The inspection will verify that the sheet piles have the required length to reach the necessary depth for proper driving
Specification Reference - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works
Acceptance Criteria - All welds to be visually inspected and if any defects are found, they need to be reported.
Specification Reference - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Before removing any walers
Acceptance Criteria - Report all QA for concrete to the Engineer including delivery dockets and report on placing before removing any Walers.
Specification Reference - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
4.01 - Location and marking of the cofferdam and crane pad.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works

Acceptance Criteria - The final location of the cofferdam and the working platform should be clearly marked on-site, ensuring the dimensions and alignment with respect to the pier extension, and considering the proximity shown on the drawing.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Frequency - Prior to sheet piles instalation
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - During construction

Acceptance Criteria - The sheet piles will be driven down with the excavator to just below the platform level, ensuring the design height is achieved and that the piles have reached rock level. Report sheetpile embedment depths to the TW Engineer
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Frequency - Driven down of sheet piles
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - During construction

Acceptance Criteria - Check the levels of the underside of the waler to ensure it is just above the top of the new pier. Install and support the Top Waler. Drive the sheet piles around the waler. Weld the Top Waler in place.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - During construction

Acceptance Criteria - During the lagging installation between sheetpiles and bridge Abutment, ensure there is sufficient space for the formwork, with a minimum clearance of 900mm. The lagging must be securely fastened both to the sheet pile and the pier.
○ As new boards are placed underneath, they may need to be held to the lagging above. Uuse vertical boards nailed to the lagging above if necessary to hold the new lagging in place.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - During construction
Acceptance Criteria - Monitor excavation and ensure that measurements are being taken to not exceed depths.

○ The TWC shall inspect the waler before excavation proceeds. Excavate to a maximum depth of 2.25m, then install the brackets and the second waler. Pack the space between the waler and the sheet piles with grout bags.
○ Support the Waler using chains from the Waler above if necessary until excavation has continued far enough to weld the bracing leg to the bracket.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - During construction
Acceptance Criteria - Monitor excavation and ensure that measurements are being taken to not exceed depths.
○ Excavate to 3.58m (max) BGL, install brackets and install 3rd Waler.
○ Pack between Waler & Sheetpiles with grout bags.
○ Support the Waler as noted above if necessary as excavation proceeds.
○ TWC to inspect Waler before excavation proceeds.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Welding review

Acceptance Criteria - All welds to be visually inspected by the TWC and any defects reported to the Engineer. Each of the 100mm long stubs are to be identified, marked and photos of each sent to the Engineer for approval.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Inspection/ Hold point
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Welding review
Acceptance Criteria - All welds to be 6mm Fillet Weld all round UNO.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Inspection/ Hold point
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Prior to works
Acceptance Criteria - The platform level must be 325mm below the road level at the center location of the bridge.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - During construction
Acceptance Criteria - Install reidbar ties 500mm below top of platform
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - During construction
Acceptance Criteria - TWC to inspect bracket braces before excavating to full depth. Fully de-water and clean out down to rock level
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - During construction

Acceptance Criteria - Cast concrete toe support 400mm thick. Report all QA for concrete to the Engineer including delivery dockets and report on placing before removing any Walers. Remove second and third walers after 7 days.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Frequency - After excavating to full depth
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - After sheet pile installation
Acceptance Criteria - PVC sheeting is to start from the far side of the bridge and continue past the cofferdam, as advised by the waterproofing contractor.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - After sheet pile installation
Acceptance Criteria - Attach the PVC sheeting to the sheet piles and to the concrete bridge pier beneath the bridge.
Verifying Document - Please refer to Bridge 3 – Temporary Works Design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Documentation

Acceptance Criteria - All hold points must be formally reported to the Engineer for inspection. A photographic record of the inspected works shall be maintained. Proceeding beyond any hold point requires explicit approval from the Engineer.
